text: Indole-5,6-quinone Mitomycin Apaziquone Indolequinones are molecules which are based upon an indole but have two additional ketone groups (quinone) attached to the ring structure. This simple indolequinone indole-5,6-quinone is produced during the ripening of some fruit. Other examples of indolequinones and the related mitosenes include natural compound mitomycin and the related chemotherapeutic agent apaziquone. ==External links== * Category:Indolequinones
title: Indolequinone
